intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. resvoll-holmseniae, commonly known as the Resvoll-Holmsenia buttercup, is a rare and distinctive subspecies native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive greenish center and deeply lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in alpine and subalpine habitats. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
